description:
The Buyer Planner will plan, release and manage production work orders and purchase orders to fulfill production requirements. Position will also be responsible for monitoring and managing assigned value streams and planner codes including inventory and customer service levels. Will also be responsible for planning finished goods inventory levels for distribution.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

  • Releases and manages production requisitions in accordance with Heijunka level loading, kanban signals, production plan goals and related planning data.
  • Places and manages purchases orders in accordance with MRP, Kanban signals, production plan goals and related planning data.
  • Works closely with manufacturing and suppliers to prioritize, expedite and de-expedite work orders and purchase orders based on material availability, department resources, changing requirements and customer service requirements.
  • Manage the assigned value streams including the management of inventory turns improvement, backorder reduction and coordinating activities with other planner buyers and departments.
  • Participates in the new product development process and supports supply chain planning activities at the new product team level.
  • Manage, monitor and update Kanbans for assigned value streams and production cells.
  • Have strong working knowledge and apply the principles of planning/pull system.
  • Have an understanding of lean manufacturing.
  • Manage and maintain inventory levels to the company goals at the raw, sub-assembly, WIP and finished good levels.
  • Monitors and understands key planning parameters such as safety stocks, buffer stocks and lot sizes.
  • Works closely with vendors to manage and control product lines, to prioritize, expedite and assure enough material supply to support customer demand.

Required

Job Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) in Business, Supply Chain, or Operations or at least 2 years of Buyer/Planner experience in a manufacturing or distribution environment in lieu of education
  • Seeking minimum of 2+ year of Buyer/Planner work experience

Preferred Skills

  • Strong analytical and mathematical skills
  • Strong knowledge of ERP, Kanban and Pull system
  • Understanding of production principles and processes
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively work with many levels and types of people
  • Good written, oral, and presentation skills (Communication)
  • Problem solving and solid business decision making skills
  • Planning and organizational ability
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Word, etc.)
  • APICS Certification a plus
